borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The development, by reasons of the height of the extension, combined with the depth and orientation of the&nbsp;terrace and proximity to the adjoining neighbour results in an unacceptable loss of daylight and overshadowing and sense of overbearing, detrimental to the living conditions of the Number 3 Shortcrofts Road, contrary to:</p><p>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019)<br>- Policies 3.5, 7.1, 7.4, and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016)<br>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011)<br>- Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020).<br>- Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (February 2012)</p>

<p class="MsoNormal">The development,&nbsp;by reasons of its height and overall
scale and massing appears a discordant addition to the dwelling house, considered harmful to the appearance and character of the dwelling house, the host
terrace to which it forms a part and the wider Becontree Estate. The addition
has resulted in the creation of small and unusable spaces within the rear
garden with the development representing a poor standard of design, visible from within the street scene and neighbouring dwellings, contrary to:</p><p class="MsoNormal">- National
Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019)<br>- Policies 7.1, 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of The London Plan (March 2016)<br>- Policies HC1, D1 and D4 of the Draft London Plan (December 2019)<br>- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Core Strategy DPD (July 2010)<br>- Policies BP2, BP5 and BP11 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011)<br>- Policies SPP6, SP2, DMD1, DMNE3, DMD4 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19
Consultation version, October&nbsp;2020).<br>- Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (February 2012)</p><p class="MsoNormal"><o:p></o:p></p>
description: Construction of a single storey rear extension (retrospective).
